examples.text: tell me about his role skills
I'd like to know more about his Skills
I'd like to learn about his skills
I want to know about his skills
is that all you can say
you are a very bad bot
John's CV is not what we are looking for
Tell John to add some personal details to his cv
Tell John to add language skills to his cv
Make sure your spelling is correct
I think your answers are a bit too long
What did John do at allied domecq
tell me about his musical interests

values: Bye for now
Tell me your email address please
OK so you want me to email John's CV to <?input.text?>?

Before you go click on this link to view John's full CV

Its been great chatting with you. Bye.

got it.
I am designed to respond to the following intents: 1) I want to know about John's employment history 2) I want to know about John's skills 3) I want to know about John's interests 4) I want to leave some feedback 5) I want to know how John built you. Please select one option 1-5 that best categorises your intent. If your intention does not match one of the options above please describe your intent.

To train me you need to input the statement you would like me to understand and then tell me the intention behind the statement. If you can map your statement to one of the existing intentions great if not you can describe your intention. John will review this and train me later to improve my performance.
<?$TrainingIntent?> got it. Thank you for helping me become a better chatbot. John will review this training suggestion and if appropriate I will be trained on this suggestion.
Its been great speaking with you.
OK I've mailed John's CV to $TwitterHandle. It's been great speaking with you.
Hi there...Lets start with a summary of John's CV.
Thanks for the feedback.
I'm sorry I didn't understand what you wanted me to do. I'm only trained to speak about John's CV.

John's career in IT spans around 30 years. He has extensive experience in a variety of roles ranging from hands on software development, leadership of technical teams through to strategic technical leadership.

John has a passion for new technology and is now focusing on cognitive computing and AI, specialising in IBM Watson. John has is a certified IBM Cloud Developer and a certified IBM Watson Developer

John's domain experience includes Investment Banking, Retail Banking, IT consultancy, distribution and manufacturing and the Scotch Whisky industry.

Perhaps unusually for a person with deep technical interests John has an MBA demonstrating interests and knowledge beyond the technical realm.
OK enough with the employment history. Lets step back a bit in our conversation.

I'm John's CV Bot. I can talk to you about John's CV but I'm not trained to talk about anything else. You can ask me for details of John's skills, employment history, qualificatons and his interests. Here are some hints and tips to help you interact with me.
If you type "reset" then I will forget our conversation and start over at the very beiginning.
If you make a statement indicating how you feel about me I'll intepret that as feedback and I'll understand any emotion convered in your words e.g. "I hate chatbots" will be intepreted as feedback with the dominant emotion being anger! John will monitor feedback and where appropriate will make improvements.
If there is something that you say to me on the subject of John's CV then you can help train me by telling me the intention behind the phrase I have not udnerstood. John will review training suggestions and where appropriate train me on them.

OK you asked me how John made me.

I'm a Node.js application running in the IBM Cloud. I use Watson Conversation to understand what you say and decide how I will respond. I also look for emotional tones in what you say to me so that I can respond appropriately. I do this using Watson Tone Analyser. I am designed so you can speak with me from multiple messaging platforms such as Facebook Messenger or Slack as well as the web. I store your feedback in a Cloudant No SQL database.
Thats OK lets get back to our converation.
Resetting conversation.....
Ask me about John's time at Clydesdale & Yorkshire Bank, JPMorgan Chase, Campbell Lee and Allied Domecq.

I'm only kidding about the spidey sense..that's not a real thing :) I actually used IBM Watson's Tone Analyser service to interpret the sentiment expressed in your words. Watson suggested $emotion as the dominant emotional tone.
Hi I'm John's CV Bot. I'm here to tell you about John and his work experience. I can also explain how he made me using IBM Watson. Lets get started.

In 2017 John founded CogniSys. CogniSys exists to harness the power of Artificial Intelligence, taking AI capabilities that were previously the preserve of computer science PHD's and the tech giants and putting it in the hands of regular users, regardless of level of their IT capablity, enabling them to create innovate products, services and processes

Prior to this John worked at Clydesdale & Yorkshire Banking Group from 2011 to 2017 and held a variety of technical leadership roles during this time.

From 2008-2011 John worked at JPMorgan as Build Manager in F&O Clearing.

Prior to that John worked as an IT consultant at Campbell Lee Computer Services for around 12 years and before that he was a systems analyst at the drinks firm Allied Domecq.

I think its fair to say John is obsessed with guitars and guitar playing. His pride and joy is his Gibson ES339 guitar. John is particularly interested in solo jazz guitar. Joe Pass, Martin Taylor and Wes Montgommery are major influences. John's musical ambition is to do live solo jazz guitar performance. Here is a short clip of John playing the jazz standard Misty

John enjoys sport and is keen on personal fitness and improving his performance. Swimming is his favorite activity. He has taught himself from scratch over the last few years based on the principles of Total Immersion Swimming and swims 2K front crawl at least 3 times a week. He also runs 10K once a week and a takes part in a weekly game of football with friends on a Friday after work.

John has an MBA in Technology Management (with merit) from the Open University Business School, B.Sc (Hons) Physics with Advanced Mathematics from the University of Glasgow and 5 A Highers from his school days.

In 2016 John earned a certificate from Open University Business School entitled Understanding Financial Technologies (Fintech). John is currently studying with Udacity where he is undertaking their AI nanodegree program.

John has achieved several IBM professional certifications and is an IBM Certified Cloud Developer and an IBM Certified Watson Developer.

In 2016 John earned Devlopers Guide to Internet of Things from Coursera and the following IBM badges; Bluemix Essentials, Node-Red: Basics to Bots, Building Chatbots with Watson and Cloud Application Developer Certification Preparation

In 2016/17 John completed Japanese Language Stage 1 at University of Glasgow

John has worked at Clydesdale & Yorkshire Banking Group (formerly National Australia) since 2011. During that time he has held a variety of technical leadership roles.
John worked as Technical Lead in Core Banking where he modernised the tools and processes used by the core banking mainframe development teams. His highlight from his time in this role was identifying a cost saving of £100k from replacing legacy development tools with modern IBM Rational tools (RDz, RTC and IBM Debug). He produced a business case and secured funding for the initiative. He rolled the tools out across the mainframe teams and measured the results. As well as the £100k cost saving the mainframe developers were 7x more productive using the new tools..
His work in process improvement with RTC led to a move into a transformation leadership role in 2015. In this role he designed a methodology for all build teams in the bank's development centre to plan and track work. This utilised elements of Lean and Agile practice but pragmatically integrated these with the bank's enterprise project management method. In 2016 he moved he into the bank's newly established innovation team where he developed a strategy for internal employee facing mobile apps based on Microsoft O365 and Microsoft PowerApps and built the first internal mobile app allowing teams to measure employee engagement using these technologies.
John is married to his lovely wife Karen and they have two great kids Andrew and Robbie who are both at secondary school. They also have a dog called Chappie who is an adorable Cockapoo.

John is passionately interested in science and technology. He has a long held interest in physics and astronomy since his university days and is an avid reader of the scientific press. Since meeting Softbank's Pepper robot in Japan he has become fascinated with robots and AI. John is building a robot with his son, this robot is based on Raspberry Pi and uses Watson as its brain. John enjoys studying these subjects and takes courses to learn more and improve his knowledge.

John is skilled in the roles of IT consultant (12 years), team leader (4 years), software developer (30 years) and technical leader (5 years).

John's domain skills span investment banking (4 years), retail banking (5 years), IT professional services (12 years), distribution, manufacturing and the Scotch Whisky industry (6 years) .

John has a wide range of technical skills spanning multiple technologies. He has skills in software development and integration with IBM Watson and IBM Cloud using Node.js and Watson Services.

John has deep IBM mid-range and mainframe expertise including RPG and COBOL software development, expertise in Waterfall and Agile methodologies and IBM Rational Tools.

John's application experience includes Sungard GMI (Futures & Options clearing), JBA System21 (ERP) and Microsoft Dynamics Nav (ERP).

John recently produced a strategy for internal employee facing mobile apps at Clydesdale Bank. This is to be based on Microsoft O365 and will use Microsoft PowerApps and Microsoft Flow. As part of this work Jon developed a mobile app using PowerApps and Flow. This app allows teams within the bank to survey and monitor employee engagement and provides analysis capabilities to the survey owners.

John's career in IT spans around 30 years. He has extensive experience in a variety of roles ranging from hands on software development, leadership of technical teams through to strategic technical leadership.

John has a passion for new technology and is now focusing on cognitive computing and AI, specialising in IBM Watson. John has is a certified IBM Cloud Developer and a certified IBM Watson Developer

John's domain experience includes Investment Banking, Retail Banking, IT consultancy, distribution and manufacturing and the Scotch Whisky industry.

Perhaps unusually for a person with deep technical interests John has an MBA demonstrating interests and knowledge beyond the technical realm.

John's career in IT spans around 30 years. He has extensive experience in a variety of roles ranging from hands on software development, leadership of technical teams through to strategic technical leadership.

John has a passion for new technology and is now focusing on cognitive computing and AI, specialising in IBM Watson. John has is a certified IBM Cloud Developer and a certified IBM Watson Developer

John's domain experience includes Investment Banking, Retail Banking, IT consultancy, distribution and manufacturing and the Scotch Whisky industry.

Perhaps unusually for a person with deep technical interests John has an MBA demonstrating interests and knowledge beyond the technical realm.

John started working in the Scotch Whisky industry in 1988. His first job was at James Burrough Distillers and he later moved to Allied Domecq. During this time he progressed from graduate trainee to the role of systems analyst responsible for the firm's financial ledgers. He considers himself very fortunate to have started off in such a well structured and supportive environment and remains very grateful to his colleagues from that time.

John visited Japan with his family in 2106 and found the experience to be inspirational. While in Japan they met Softbank's Pepper robot which sparked John's interest in Artificial Intelligence and inspired him to learn about IBM's Watson. What he did not expect was that his son Andrew would enrol them in Japanese language classes at the University of Glasgow when they got home! They now study Japanese together every Monday night.

John worked as an IT consultant for Campbell Lee Computer Servcies (latterly Onyx ) for around 12 years. He performed a variety of roles during that time including pre-sales consultancy, project management, application consultancy, application configuration and software development. He specialised in ERP solutions for manufacturing and distribution organisations, specifically JBA System21, and Microsoft Dynamics Nav. Clients included firms such as Vanity Fair, Robert Wiseman Dairies, Baker Hughes, Noble Drilling and Russell Athletic.

John worked for just around 4 years at JPMorgan Chase. He worked as Build Manager in Futures and Options Clearing where he managed a hybrid on/offshore build team delivering changes to the the bank's GMI F&O Clearing platform. This was a highly pressured role in an extremely complex environment where a mistake could have vast financial and reputational consequences for the bank. This role involved leadership and management skills alongside detailed technical skills in RPG software development and GMI. John chaired the EMEA stakeholder meeting to prioritise and approve the team's work and to manage stakeholder expectations. He led the team from the front by gathering business requirements, elaborating these to functional and technical specifications and ensuring that best practice was adhered to at all stages of delivery. During his time in this role he was very successful in increasing the team's output while increasing the quality of its delivery.

John worked for more than 4 years in the role of Build Manager at JPMorgan Chase where he led a hyrbrid onshore/ offshore team of software developers. This role involved skills in stakeholder management at a senior level, requirements gathering and elaboration, software design, team leadership and mentoring
My spidey sense detected $emotion in your response. I'm happy I made you feel $emotion.
My spidey sense tells me your feedback is emotionally neutral. If this is not your intention please restate the feedback in stronger terms so I can understand it.
OK lets start with a summary.

So far we have discussed John's .

You can ask me for for more detail on John's .
$spideyPhrase $emotion in your response. I'm sorry I made you feel $emotion. Chatbots can have that effect I guess!
Ask me more about John's interests in music, technology, fitness, Japan or his family.
Find out more about John's interests in technology, music, Japan or sport

John has a passionate interest in science and technology and is particularly interested in AI, IoT and Robotics, he loves music and plays guitar and banjo in a Celeidh band. John is also keen on sports and is obsessed with Japan and all things Japanese. Ask me about any of these topics and I'll tell you more.
